lines.speaker: Dr. Keats
lines.text: He doesn't offer you a seat. He's polishing his glasses with a surgical grace. "The police took my statement. It was exhaustive. And exhausting."

choices.text: “They missed the mud on your boots, Doctor.”
Say nothing. Just look at the glasses.
[Theory] “The statement was a fabrication. To protect the project.”

lines.speaker: Dr. Keats
lines.text: The polishing stops. He holds the glasses up to the light. "I take walks. Is walking a crime now, Detective? Or do you prefer 'Inquisitor'?"

lines.speaker: Dr. Keats
lines.text: He puts the glasses back on. The lenses magnify his eyes—too large, too wet. "You're waiting for a crack. A slip. I don't slip."

lines.speaker: Dr. Keats
lines.text: "Fine." He sits, finally. The leather chair groans. "The clearing. I saw lights. Not electrical. Biological. Bioluminescence on a macro scale."

choices.text: Note it down. Leave without a word.

lines.speaker: Dr. Keats
lines.text: "Get out of my house. Before I call the Sheriff. He owes me a favor."

lines.speaker: Dr. Keats
lines.text: He turns very pale. "You shouldn't say that name. Not here. The wood loves that name."
